Closed K-12 schools: ON, NS, PEI: school closures became effective on the first day of March Break (16th of March), but were only applied on the 23rd of March when students were supposed to return from the break. YK: Same, but became effective in the middle of March break on 18th of March
Closed daycares: In BC, the government has asked parents who can care for their children at home to do so, but hasn't outright closed daycares. YK: restrictions on daycares, owners can close them if they prefer, but government asks to keep spaces open for children of essential workers. NT: Daycares are considered an essential service and are asked to stay open.
Restricted visits to long-term care home: NL, NS, NB, QC, MB, SK: traveled in past 14-days; ON: screening of visitors; AB: one essential visitor; BC: limited to those who routinely provide assistance; SK update 17-03-2020: limited to immediate family
Banned visits to long-term care homes: YK: Unless family-member is gravely ill or at end of life. NT: No visitors to long-term care homes, but 1 visitor allowed for acute care homes.
Closed non-essential businesses: BC, NS and NT, non-essential businesses are allowed to operate if they maintain social distancing. YK and NU: only closed restaurants bars and personal services businesses.
Closed cannabis and liquor stores: ON closed cannabis, but not liquor stores
Closed gyms: BC: No outright closure order though some regional authorities have closed indoor gyms.
Closed movie theaters: For BC, NS and YK, no clear order to close, though all movie theaters appear to have closed on their own. NU: The only theatre in the province is under renovation, but the province has closed other spectator venues such as sports and concerts.
Ordered freezing utility shut offs: In NS, NL and NB, the utilities corporation took the decision.
Fines for profiteering: ON: fines for businesses increasing profit; BC: fines for resale of essential goods; SK: prosecution, not fines.
Restrictions on Interprovincial/territor: PE, NS, NB, QC, MB, YK: checkpoints on land borders. NT, NU: banned all non-residents from entering the territory (YK Starting April 17).
Order self-isolation for domestic travel: MB: "strongly advised", NU: self-isolation mandatory for 14-days prior to boarding flight to Nunavut.
